Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class SelectorLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.SelectorLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class SelectorLoop
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Worker selector loop for handling I/O events.

    Handles OP_READ and OP_WRITE events for both TCP connections and UDP datagrams. Uses the ChannelHandler interface to dispatch events to the appropriate handler type.

    All I/O and TLS/DTLS processing for a handler occurs on its assigned SelectorLoop thread.

    TODO: Add a task queue facility to allow external threads to submit tasks for execution on the loop thread. This would enable truly async handler responses in the staged handler pattern - handlers could respond from any thread, and the State implementations would queue the response for execution on the correct SelectorLoop.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts this SelectorLoop. Creates a new thread if needed and starts processing.

      • invokeLater

        public void invokeLater​(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Schedules a task to run on this SelectorLoop thread. If called from this thread, the task is executed immediately. Otherwise, it is queued and the selector is woken up.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute

      • join

        public void join()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for this SelectorLoop's thread to terminate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting
